TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit DataKeyCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable

Docs.summary: Represents a collection that contains the key field of each record in a data source. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The DataKeyCollection class represents a collection of the key fields in the data source. The key field of each record in the data source is stored in this collection. This allows you to store the key field with a data listing control without displaying it in the control. This collection is automatically filled with the values from the field specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataList.DataKeyField%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property. This collection does not allow you to manually add or remove items from the collection.
The key field is commonly used in a handler for an event, such as `ItemCommand` or `DeleteCommand`, as part of an update query string to revise a specific record in the data source. The key field helps the update query string identify the appropriate record to modify.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyCollection.Count%2A> property to determine the number of items in the collection. To programmatically retrieve a key field from a DataKeyCollection, use one of following methods:
- Use the indexer to get a single key field from the collection, using array notation.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyCollection.CopyTo%2A> method to copy the contents of the collection to a <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object, which can then be used to get items from the collection.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyCollection.GetEnumerator%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> implemented object, which can then be used to get items from the collection.
## Examples [!code-cs[BaseDataListDataKeys#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_330_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[BaseDataListDataKeys#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_330_1.aspx)]

Docs.param: A that contains key fields from the data source.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyCollection> class.

Docs.param: A zero-based <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object that receives the copied items from the .
The first position in the specified <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object to receive the copied contents.
Docs.summary: Copies all the items from the to the specified <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object, starting at the specified index in the <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to copy the contents of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyCollection> into the specified <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object, starting at the specified index.
> [!NOTE] > The `array` parameter must be a zero-based <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> object.

Docs.summary: Gets the number of items in the collection.
Docs.value: The number of items in the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the Count property to determine the number of items in the collection. This property is commonly used when iterating through the collection to determine the upper bound.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> implemented object that contains all key fields in the .
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> implemented object that contains all key fields in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to create a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> implemented object that can be iterated through to get each item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyCollection>.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to get the item currently pointed to in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move to the next item in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move the enumerator to its initial position.
> [!NOTE] > After you create a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> implemented object or use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move the enumerator to the first item in the collection, you must call the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method. Otherwise, the item represented by the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is undefined.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether items in the can be modified.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property always returns `false` to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyCollection> can be written to in all cases.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the is synchronized (thread-safe).

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is derived from the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface and is overridden to always return `false` to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyCollection> is not thread-safe.
For more information on the IsSynchronized property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.

Docs.param: The zero-based index of the key field to retrieve from the collection.
Docs.summary: Gets the key field at the specified index in the collection.
Docs.value: The key field at the specified index in the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this indexer to get the key field from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyCollection> at the specified index, using array notation.

Docs.summary: Gets the object used to synchronize access to the .
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Object?displayProperty=fullName> that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The object returned in this implementation is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataKeyCollection> object itself.
For more information on the SyncRoot property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.
